subject: no matter if it's black or white !?
msgSnippet: hi, just a sentence for relaxing, out of Robert Binders Testing OO Software.. It doesn t matter whether a cat is black or white so long as it catches mice
messageBody:
hi,

just a sentence for relaxing, out of Robert Binders "Testing OO Software.."

It doesn't matter whether a cat is black or white
so long as it catches mice
(Deng Xiaoping).


-----Urspr√ºngliche Nachricht-----
Von: ipreussde [mailto:ilja.preuss@...]
Gesendet: Montag, 6. Mai 2002 23:24
An: junit@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: [junit] Re: black box or white box?



> > For example, for some index class, if you know it uses a linear
list up
> > to 5 items and then a hash table, choosing to test with 4 items
to test
> > the list case and also test with 5 items to test the hash table
case is
> > white box testing.
>
> Yes. That is an example of whitebox testing.
>
> [...]
>
> Different tools for different fools:
>
> JUnit is designed for blackbox testing. That is how it should be
used.
> The new JDK 1.4 assertion facilities are for whitebox testing.
That is
> how they should be used.

Can you please explain why it would be a bad idea to use JUnit in the
above example and how assertions would be the more appropriate tool?

Thanx, Ilja
